item.title: (PI) Adding ::suggest command help?
item.dc:creator: @Skiire Skiire
item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

I don’t know where you’re stuck with this, but think about this logically.

You want it to write out to a text document, right? So, check out some pre-existing codes that do just that.

Example:

		if (playerCommand.startsWith("ban"))
			try {
				final String[] args = playerCommand.split("-");
				if (args.length < 2) {
					c.sendMessage("Correct usage: ::ban-playername-time");
					return;
				}
				final String playerToBan = args[1];
				final int secondsToBan = Integer.parseInt(args[2]) * 1000;
				for (int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++)
					if (PlayerHandler.players[i] != null)
						if (PlayerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToBan)) {
							final Player o = PlayerHandler.players[i];
							// o.banStart = System.currentTimeMillis();
							// o.banEnd = System.currentTimeMillis()+
							// secondsToBan;
							o.disconnected = true;
							// PlayerHandler.players[i].banStart =
							// System.currentTimeMillis();
							// PlayerHandler.players[i].banEnd = Long.MAX_VALUE;
							Connection.addNameToBanList(playerToBan);
							Connection.addNameToFile(playerToBan);
							break;
						}
				c.sendMessage("You banned the player: " + playerToBan + " for " + secondsToBan / 1000 + " seconds");
			} catch (final Exception e) {
				c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline.");
			}

If you look at this carefully you can see it’s using addNameToBanList and addNameToFile. So, since I’m using Eclipse I’ll do a call-hierarchy and find those two methods.

	public static void addNameToBanList(final String name) {
		Connection.bannedNames.add(name.toLowerCase());
	}
	public static ArrayList<String> bannedNames = new ArrayList<String>();

That should at least be enough to give you a push in the right direction. If you have any specific questions, I’ll be willing to help.
